Lack enough support: The claim that "COVID-19 started because we eat animals" lacks enough support as there is no evidence to suggest that eating meat is the source of the coronavirus outbreak.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption by linking COVID-19 to meat consumption without sufficient evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: There are alternative explanations for the origin of COVID-19, such as the possibility of it originating in bats and then jumping to another animal host before spreading to humans.
Understate: The claim understates the complexity of the origins of COVID-19 by simplifying it to a single cause (eating animals).
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that scientists are still trying to determine the exact source of COVID-19 and there is no evidence to support the claim that meat consumption caused the outbreak.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the role of meat consumption in the spread of COVID-19 by stating that the virus would not exist if the world was vegan, which is not supported by evidence.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by relying on baseless claims and misinformation, such as linking the disease to the consumption of bats in China without sufficient evidence.
